inlineContent.text: You create a
object, set any options you want, and then
call a sync or async connect operation, which returns a
subclass on success.
The type of the
object returned depends on the type of
the underlying socket that is in use. For instance, for a TCP/IP connection
it will be a
As
is a lightweight object, you donâ€™t need to cache it. You
can just create a new one any time you need one.
The
protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying
instance.
The default implementation of these can be found in the protocol extension below.
For a concrete class that implements these methods and properties, see
Alternatively, use
as a lighweight,
reference if you already have an instance you just want to use.
